intro: Pilosella leptadenia, commonly known as the slender-leaved hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Pilosella leptadenia is generally a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
